title: MLLM Pretraining with Event Semantic Structures

definitions.Structured Alignment: Alignment of structured data, such as text and image event graphs, to optimize transport.
definitions.Cost Matrix: A matrix used to measure the similarity between elements of two datasets.
definitions.Optimization Goal: Minimize transport distance between aligned elements.

summary: The slide discusses MLLM Pretraining with Event Semantic Structures, focusing on Structured Alignment via Optimal Transport. It defines a cost matrix for embedding similarity and outlines the optimization goal of minimizing transport distance. The slide also includes a diagram of an Image Event Graph and a mathematical formula for the Sinkhorn Knopp algorithm.
